pullrequest.title: Slimmed down the Plugin pull request (no more template specializations)

content.raw:
Thanks for digging deep into this. As far as I understand it, there is no universally acceptable practice regarding the use of get and each library just adopts their own style.

I don't have a strong opinion about it except for the fact that we've been putting a lot of effort on getting rid of `Get`. I hear your worries about semantics, but I suspect that it is a big stretch to think that users will interpret `Get` as meaning "return an immutable reference as opposed to a mutable one" .

In any case, I'm ok with leaving this the way it is if no one else has a problem with it.
content.html:
Thanks for digging deep into this. As far as I understand it, there is no universally acceptable practice regarding the use of get and each library just adopts their own style.

I don't have a strong opinion about it except for the fact that we've been putting a lot of effort on getting rid of Get. I hear your worries about semantics, but I suspect that it is a big stretch to think that users will interpret Get as meaning "return an immutable reference as opposed to a mutable one" .

In any case, I'm ok with leaving this the way it is if no one else has a problem with it.
